summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell and requesting she be allowed access to them.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the correspondence, an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center for whom discovery materials are being provided.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The author of the letter, transmitting discovery materials on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Strauss, as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is part of the prosecution team providing discovery to the defense for defendant Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to MDC
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office transmits discovery materials pertaining to Ghislaine Maxwell to the Metropolitan Detention Center for her access.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal correspondence dated November 18, 2020, from the U.S. Attorney's Office to the Metropolitan Detention Center.
It concerns the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
Its purpose is to transmit discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell and request the facility allow her access to them.
Audrey Strauss, an Assistant U.S. Attorney, signed the letter, indicating her involvement in the prosecution.
